answers.answer: NARCALEPSY!!!!  I know I spelled it wrong but oh well.  My friend had the same or similar problem..  One day we were all standing together talking and my friend said she wasnt feeling well and then she seemed not there like she was in a daze but she was staring at me...then all of the sudden she hit the floor hard just toppled over... I was calling her name and no response and after a few moments she came through and she felt tired and not like herself she just wanted to leave... She went to a specialist since her doctor ruled out the same

question: Since Thanksgiving '09 I have had two fainting "episodes" and I am starting to get really concerned. When I was in the first grade it happened repeatedly, but my teacher was convinced I was trying to get attention (even though it would happen whether there was anyone there to witness it or not) so it was never dealt with. I'm 28 now and after an MRI and some blood work, there is no conclusion. But the doc wants to take my driving privileges. I get why, but that doesn't make it any easier. Both times it has happened recently it started with me feeling extremely hot all of a sudden, then nauseous, then dizzy, then I wake up on the floor (face down and injuries to my face and head). The whole thing takes less than five minutes to progress to the fainting. Both times it happened I had a sort of euphoric feeling upon coming to, then immediately felt like my whole body was glued down. I couldn't move or get up for a while (I do not know how long, but I estimate 10-15 minutes). Once I was standing up, once I was seated in a kitchen chair. The doc ruled out: 1. Anemia, 2. Diabetes, 3. Pregnancy, 4. Epilepsy, 5. Thyroid disease/disorder.  Can anyone out there help me? Has anyone ever experienced this? Does anyone know if the culprit behind by life being turned inside out even has a name?
title: Dizzy & Fainting
